content.raw:
Currently, this is blocked because we are unable to link between our Dockerhub repository and our Bitbucket repository. It should be possible to establish this link using the “Link to Bitbucket” option under “Builds”  in the osrf/vrx repository. However, the only Bitbucket team \(“organization”\) available under this interface is osrfautobuild and it does not appear to have the correct permissions to access our vrx repository on Bitbucket.

Unfortunately, I don’t have sufficient permissions to view the permissions settings to troubleshoot. @{caguero} could you check the “User and group access” settings for our osrf/vrx Bitbucket repository and see what permissions are listed for “osrfautobuild”?
content.html:
Currently, this is blocked because we are unable to link between our Dockerhub repository and our Bitbucket repository. It should be possible to establish this link using the “Link to Bitbucket” option under “Builds” in the osrf/vrx repository. However, the only Bitbucket team (“organization”) available under this interface is osrfautobuild and it does not appear to have the correct permissions to access our vrx repository on Bitbucket.

Unfortunately, I don’t have sufficient permissions to view the permissions settings to troubleshoot. @Carlos Agüero could you check the “User and group access” settings for our osrf/vrx Bitbucket repository and see what permissions are listed for “osrfautobuild”?
